title: Latin America & the Caribbean : homicide rates 2017 , by country
summary: This bar chart has 22 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in each Country on the y axis.
The Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is highest at Country El Salvador and lowest at Country Chile.
The difference of Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants between the highest and lowest Country is 57.5.

max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants in the y axis.
Country El Salvador has the highest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants and Chile has the lowest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants.
The second highest Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants is appeared to be the Country Jamaica.
The highest value at Country El Salvador is 14.37x times more than the lowest value at Chile.
Country El Salvador is higher than any other Countrys with value 61.8, followed by Jamaica, and Honduras. Down to Country Chile with the lowest value 4.3.
The Country El Salvador has 2.97 times more Homicides per 100,000 inhabitants than average.
